newsitem.title: CHINA: General Motors wants engine JV in China.
newsitem.headline: General Motors wants engine JV in China.

text.p: General Motors Corp's European subsidiary Opel AG is looking for an opportunity to start a joint venture in Guangzhou, capital of China's southern Gangdong province, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

The proposed project, probably in the Guangzhou Science and Technology Development Zone, would be to manufacture automobile engines for export, the agency quoted Louis R. Hughes, president of GM's international operations, as saying.

The local government has agreed in principle to establish the venture and has asked GM to provide a comprehensive report, Hughes said. The report had been submitted to relevant departments in Beijing for review, he said.
To support the project and coordinate GM activities in southern China, Opel set up an office in Guangzhou last year.
Guangdong's economic boom has created conditions for the purchase of private automobiles, and the Opel brand was recognised in the region, Hughes said.
Last month, GM signed a $1.57 billion joint venture with Shanghai Automotive Industry Corp to produce luxury sedans in China.
